facts.fact_text: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves decreased to USD 154.6 billion in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Indonesia’s foreign exchange reserves declined to USD 154.6 billion in January 2026

facts.fact_text: The reserves fell from a nine-month high of USD 156.5 billion in December.

evidences.evidence_text: down from a nine-month high of USD 156.5 billion in December.

facts.fact_text: The decline was driven by government's foreign debt payments and rupiah exchange rate stabilization measures.

evidences.evidence_text: The decline was primarily driven by the government’s foreign debt payments and rupiah exchange rate stabilization measures implemented by Bank Indonesia

facts.fact_text: The current reserve level is sufficient to cover 6.3 months of imports.

evidences.evidence_text: The current level is sufficient to cover 6.3 months of imports

facts.fact_text: The current reserve level is sufficient to cover 6.1 months when accounting for government's external debt repayments.

evidences.evidence_text: or 6.1 months when accounting for the government’s external debt repayments

facts.fact_text: The reserve level is above the international adequacy benchmark of around three months of imports.

evidences.evidence_text: well above the international adequacy benchmark of around three months of imports

evidence.evidence_text: The decline was primarily driven by the government’s foreign debt payments and rupiah exchange rate stabilization measures implemented by Bank Indonesia
The decline was primarily driven by the government’s foreign debt payments and rupiah exchange rate stabilization measures implemented by Bank Indonesia

links.source_ref: rising uncertainty in global financial markets

evidence.evidence_text: in response to rising uncertainty in global financial markets.
